item.title: John Michael Talbot
item.description: John Michael Talbot is an American Roman Catholic singer, songwriter, guitarist, author, television presenter and founder of a monastic community known as the Brothers and Sisters of Charity.

item.title: Cliff Richard
item.description: Sir Cliff Richard is a British singer, musician, performer, actor and philanthropist. Richard has sold more than 250 million records worldwide. He has total sales of over 21 million singles in the United Kingdom and is the third-top-selling artist in UK Singles Chart history, behind the Beatles and Elvis Presley.

item.title: Matthew West
item.description: Matthew Joseph West is an American contemporary Christian musician, singer-songwriter, and actor. He has released five studio albums and is known for his songs, 'More', 'You Are Everything', and 'The Motions'. He was nominated for five Dove Awards in 2005, two of which were for his major label debut album, Happy. West won the 2013 American Music Award for Best Contemporary Inspirational Artist.

item.title: Dustin Kensrue
item.description: Dustin Michael Kensrue is a musician, songwriter and former worship leader. He is the lead vocalist and rhythm guitarist in the rock band Thrice, as well as a solo artist.

item.title: Steven Curtis Chapman
item.description: Steven Curtis Chapman is an American contemporary Christian music singer, songwriter, record producer, actor, author, and social activist.

item.title: Michael W. Smith
item.description: Michael Whitaker Smith is an American musician, who has charted in both contemporary Christian and mainstream charts. His biggest success in mainstream music was in 1991 when 'Place in this World' hit No. 6 on the Billboard Hot 100. Over the course of his career, he has sold more than 18 million albums.

item.title: Peter Furler
item.description: Peter Andrew Furler is an Australian musician, songwriter, producer and record executive, best known as the co-founder and former lead vocalist of the Christian rock band Newsboys.

item.title: Paul Colman
item.description: Paul Colman, is a British–Australian pop-rock guitarist, vocalist, pianist, and composer.

item.title: Phil Keaggy
item.description: Philip Tyler 'Phil' Keaggy is an American acoustic and electric guitarist and vocalist who has released more than 50 albums and contributed to many more recordings in both the contemporary Christian music and mainstream markets. He is a seven-time recipient of the GMA Dove Award for Instrumental Album of the Year, and was twice nominated for a Grammy Award for Best Rock Gospel Album. He has frequently been listed as one of the world's top-three 'finger-style', as well as 'finger-picking', guitarists by Guitar Player Magazine readers' polls.
